urls.description: Penn Med Center for Digital Health has created a COVID-19 Twitter map that includes charts detailing sentiment, symptoms reported, state-by-state data cuts, and border data on the COVID-19 outbreak. In addition, their Penn Med With You initiative uses aggregate regional information from Twitter to inform their website and text-messaging service. The service uses this information to disseminate relevant and timely resources.
urls.title: Penn Medicine Center for Digital Health

data.text:
See how @PennMedCDH are using Twitter data to understand the COVID-19 health crisis üìä

https://t.co/1tdA8uDWes

tweets.text:
Dr. @RainaMerchant and her team at the Penn Medicine CDH are helping build the future of health care.

The team is using insights from social data in many different ways ‚Äî ranging from uncovering risk factors to shedding light on public sentiment. üîé

urls.description: Today, we‚Äôre happy to announce the general availability of the hide replies endpoint in the new Twitter API. The hide replies endpoint allows you to build tools that help people hide or unhide replies to their Tweets. People manage their replies for many reasons, including to give less attention to comments that are abusive, distracting, misleading, or to make conversations more engaging. Through this endpoint, you can build tools to help people on Twitter hide or unhide replies faster and more...
urls.title: Hide replies now available in the new Twitter API

data.text:
The hide replies endpoint is launching today! 

Developers can hide replies to Tweets - a crucial way developers can help improve the health of the public conversation using the #TwitterAPI.

https://t.co/khXhTurm9x

urls.description: Introducing the new Twitter API - rebuilt from the ground up to deliver new features faster so developers can help the world connect to the public conversation happening on Twitter.
urls.title: Introducing a new and improved Twitter API

data.text:
It‚Äôs finally here! ü•Å Say hello to the new #TwitterAPI.

We‚Äôre rebuilding the Twitter API v2 from the ground up to better serve our developer community. And today‚Äôs launch is only the beginning.

https://t.co/32VrwpGaJw https://t.co/KaFSbjWUA8

urls.description: As we said in our Early Access and hide replies announcements, the following Twitter Developer Labs v2 endpoints will be retired on November 16th. Labs v2 recent search Labs v2 hide replies If called, these endpoints will respond with an HTTP 410 status and return no data. Based on your feedback from Labs, we incorporated corresponding functionality into the Twitter API v2. The relevant documentation can be found using the links below. Click here to enroll in v2 access if you haven‚Äôt already...
urls.title: Retiring Labs v2 recent search and hide replies

tweets.text: üëã Friendly reminder that Twitter Developer Labs v2 hide replies and recent search will be retired next Monday, November 16! We encourage you to migrate to the new hide replies and recent search endpoints now available in the v2 #TwitterAPI. Details: https://t.co/r6z6CI7kEy
